This isnâ€™t a tell-all memoir, itâ€™s more like an autobiography of sensation, emotion, and instinct. It reads as a reflection on the experience of being, not just doing. While he touches on all his major roles, on stage and screen, it never feels like a typical behind-the-scenes account. Instead, itâ€™s an intimate meditation on performance, presence, and resilience.
